TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StringConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert string objects to and from other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert to a string. It works as a pass through for other converters that want to convert an object to a string.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of <xref:System.ComponentModel.StringConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A that represents the type you wish to convert from.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the given source type to a string using the specified context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

public: override System::Object ^ ConvertFrom(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^ culture, System::Object ^ value);

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified value object to a object.
Docs.returns: An that represents the converted value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so you always need to check its value. In addition, properties on the context object can return `null`.

Docs.exception: The conversion could not be performed.
